title: CVPR_2004_30_abs

sentences.text: Background modeling is an important component of many vision systems .
Existing work in the area has mostly addressed scenes that consist of static or quasi-static structures .
When the scene exhibits a persistent dynamic behavior in time , such an assumption is violated and detection performance deteriorates .
In this paper , we propose a new method for the modeling and subtraction of such scenes .
Towards the modeling of the dynamic characteristics , optical flow is computed and utilized as a feature in a higher dimensional space .
Inherent ambiguities in the computation of features are addressed by using a data-dependent bandwidth for density estimation using kernels .
Extensive experiments demonstrate the utility and performance of the proposed approach .

Entity-the_proposed_approach.label: the proposed approach
Entity-the_proposed_approach.description: A new method for modeling and subtracting scenes that exhibit persistent dynamic behavior in time, utilizing optical flow as a feature in a higher dimensional space.

Entity-in_this_paper.label: In this paper
Entity-in_this_paper.description: This paper proposes a new method for background modeling and scene subtraction when dealing with persistent dynamic behavior in time.

aliases: we propose a new method for the modeling and subtraction of such scenes
Entity-we_propose_a_new_method_for_the_m.description: A novel approach for processing dynamic visual scenes, enabling more accurate detection performance.

aliases: as a feature in a higher dimensional space
Entity-a_a_feature_in_a_higher_dimension.description: Optical flow computed and used as a characteristic representation of dynamic scene behavior, projected onto a higher-dimensional space for modeling and analysis.

aliases: optical flow is computed and utilized as a feature in a higher dimensional space
Entity-optical_flow_is_computed_and_util.description: A technique used for computing motion patterns between consecutive frames of video data, representing the apparent motion of objects within an image sequence.

Entity-towards_the_modeling.description: The process of developing methods for capturing and utilizing dynamic characteristics, specifically involving optical flow computation in higher-dimensional space.

Entity-the_dynamic_characteristic.description: The dynamic characteristics refer to the persistent behavior of scenes over time, which exhibits changes and movements that require modeling and subtraction in computer vision systems.

Entity-the_computation_of_feature.description: The process of obtaining and processing optical flow as a feature in a higher dimensional space to model dynamic characteristics.

Entity-optical_flow.label: optical flow
Entity-optical_flow.description: A technique used to measure the apparent motion of image brightness patterns between two consecutive frames, often employed as a feature in computer vision applications.

Entity-when_the_scene.description: A situation where the scene exhibits persistent dynamic behavior over time, violating assumptions and leading to deteriorated detection performance.

Entity-background_modeling.description: A technique or method used to identify and separate the background from foreground elements in images, data, or other visual representations.

Entity-data-dependent_bandwidth.label: data-dependent bandwidth
Entity-data-dependent_bandwidth.description: A technique used to estimate densities with inherent ambiguities in feature computations, where the bandwidth adapts to the characteristics of the input data.

Entity-such_an_assumption_is_violated.description: The assumption that scenes consist of static or quasi-static structures, which is typically made in background modeling.

Entity-detection_performance_deteriorate.label: detection performance deteriorates
Entity-detection_performance_deteriorate.description: The decline in effectiveness of a visual system's ability to detect objects or events when the scene exhibits persistent dynamic behavior over time.

summary: Background modeling is an important component of many vision systems . Existing work in the area has mostly addressed scenes that consist of static or quasi-static structures . When the scene exhibits a persistent dynamic behavior in time , such an assumption is violated and detection performance deteriorates . In this paper , we propose a new method for the modeling and subtraction of such scenes . Towards the modeling of the dynamic characteristics , optical flow is computed and utilized as a feature in a higher dimensional space . Inherent ambiguities in the computation of features are addressed by using a data-dependent bandwidth for density estimation using kernels . Extensive experiments demonstrate the utility and performance of the proposed approach .

Predicate-is_an_important_component_of.label: is an important component of
Predicate-is_an_important_component_of.description: This predicate indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) plays a crucial role or has significant influence on another entity (the object). The connection suggests that the subject is an integral part of, contributes to, or enhances the functionality or significance of the object.

Predicate-has_addressed.label: has addressed
Predicate-has_addressed.description: The predicate 'has addressed' indicates that the subject (a person or entity) has taken action to consider, discuss, or respond to a specific topic or issue represented by the object. This can include providing an explanation, offering solutions, or presenting arguments related to the object.

Predicate-has_mostly_addressed.label: has mostly addressed
Predicate-has_mostly_addressed.description: The predicate 'has mostly addressed' indicates a subject's primary focus on an object, suggesting that the majority of its attention, effort, or content has been directed towards it. This connection implies a significant relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject has devoted most of its resources to understanding, analyzing, or exploring the object.

Predicate-exhibits.label: exhibits
Predicate-exhibits.description: The predicate 'exhibits' indicates a relationship where the subject (in this case, 'the scene') displays or shows certain characteristics, properties, or behaviors that are described by the object. In general, it suggests a demonstration or manifestation of something inherent to the subject.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To propose means to suggest or recommend something as a potential solution, approach, or plan. It implies presenting an idea or concept for consideration and evaluation by others.

Predicate-modeling.label: modeling
Predicate-modeling.description: The predicate 'modeling' represents an act of creating or representing a conceptual framework that captures essential characteristics or patterns of its object. It implies the creation of a simplified representation, abstraction, or simulation of something complex, often for purposes such as analysis, understanding, prediction, or decision-making.

Predicate-utilized_as_a_feature_in.label: utilized as a feature in
Predicate-utilized_as_a_feature_in.description: The predicate 'utilized as a feature in' indicates that the subject (a concept or entity) has been employed or leveraged to serve as an inherent characteristic, attribute, or property within the object (another concept or domain). This connection highlights how the subject contributes to or is embedded within the object's structure, functionality, or nature.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or manifestation of a more general concept or category represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object suggests a hierarchical organization, where the subject is a subordinate part of the larger whole described by the object.
